column1: Zuckerberg dangerous anti-capitalist and autocrat

Had absolutely zero appetite for 3 days after chemo this week. I woke up today ravenous. I can’t stop eating. I had 2 Chic-Fil A chicken clubs 2 large fries a fruit cup & 2 chocolate covered pineapples & I’m still hungry. It’s dangerous to be around me right now. I could bite.

Liberal’s growing war on free speech and their love affair with totalitarianism is extremely dangerous. I don’t see any scenario where this ends well. They have no emergency brake on their behavior. They believe in “rights” not Rights. That’s NEVER ended well.

Government action is nothing more than coercive force. Government is neither omniscient nor omnipotent. It’s neither innately good nor inherently evil. It’s just force—organized collective official force. Like fire water and oxygen it’s necessary but it has to be managed with care. It’s especially dangerous when we as a society start to respond to every problem by proposing a new government program. Government inevitably expands at the expense of individual liberty. When government authority is abused we should therefore be reluctant to respond to it by giving government even more power. Doing so can resemble an attempt to extinguish a fire using gasoline.
But indoor dining is dangerous

The most dangerous woman in America calls for the complete dismantling of the political & economic systems of the USA. This hand-grenade in a headscarf should never have been allowed anywhere near power.

Lord God heavenly Father you know that we are set in the midst of so many and great dangers that by reason of the frailty of our nature we cannot always stand upright: Grant us such strength and protection to support us in all danger and carry us through all temptations; through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
You are in real danger in Minnesota right now. Can you imagine a police department having to send this out? This is your future under Democrat rule.

Heartless arrogant unelected CDC bureaucrats have decided that the lives of elderly Americans don’t count. For months the CDC has been telling us that the elderly are the most vulnerable yet they now recommend that 100 million so-called “essential workers” (healthy people working at everything from liquor stores to telephone companies) can get the vaccine before our grandparents or at-risk seniors can - people like my aunt who is imprisoned in her own home because of the danger that if she catches the disease she could die. This is immoral and bad health policy. I had planned to take the vaccine but will now stand in solidarity with our seniors by not doing so until they can. I urge my colleagues who are under 65 and healthy to join me.
